entry.title: Init 5: How it all Started
entry.content:
Whoami

Hi, My name is Waseem Akram a.k.a n0nu11. I make web apps, mobile apps, hunt bugs and design a little bit of user interfaces. Well, I‚Äôm here to share you the wonderful but boring story of mine on how i got introduced to programming and making stuffs i like and much more. So get ready with the time machine, because we are going to travel back and forth to important moments in time. Lets go way back in time.

Journey to the center of my childhood

I‚Äôve been a computer enthusiast since my childhood. i like to play and break computers, explore unkown realm of computer world. Since then i‚Äôve been curious how these magic boxes (computers) works. But a bummer, all i had is a mediocre desktop with limited and bad internet connection (Internet was‚Äônt that famous those days). i started learning how basic components like printers, scanners, modems, etc,. works. Also i broke a lot of things from software (Operating systems by misconfiguration) to hardware in the way of exploration. Thanks to my dad for getting it fixed everytime.

Nothing interesting here. lets go a little forward in time now.

Geek! Not Nerd!!

We‚Äôre here in 2012. I‚Äôm now a 13 year old calling myself a geek üòÜ, because that was the time i owned my first android phone, a old little micromax touch phone. I‚Äôve used phones before, obviously an android but that belongs to my parents so i didn‚Äôt have much freedom to explore and break things. When i got my own phone, things started rigoring. i‚Äôve learned a lot about android, iphones, their models and specs. i started tweaking around the android and installing various launchers to customise it the way i want. One fine day, i got introduced to rooting and you would‚Äôve expect it. I Rooted my phone ignoring those scary warnings about the security issues and bricking problems. Since then it changed the way i look at technology, How manufactures restrict users and how rooting breaks out the restriction and allows freedom to customise it in kernel level. Also that was the first time i got introduced to the term Hacking. I installed a lot of tweaks, apps and patched games,etc, i pretty much enjoyed the process of rooting, the thrill of rooting (because if i brick, all i had to do is throw it away or spend some lump money to fix which will never be an option for me) and the benefits i gained after rooting. Apart from geeky stuffs i did Photoshop, Video editing using nero vision.

Lets leave. come on get in the time machine‚Ä¶

The Siri tragic

Huh! Its 2014. I‚Äôm 15 now, usual studies and exams bored me as always. One fine day, My dad bought me an iPhone 4, thats the first iPhone i had. That small incredible device is a masterpiece (Thanks to Steve jobs). The speed, smoothness and camera quality blew my mind. I loved every moment with it. Well time passed, you would‚Äôve guessed it by now, ITS TIME TO JAILBREAK!!! (Jailbreak is similiar to rooting). Again i started enjoying the benefits and freedom of tweaking.

  • There wasn‚Äôt a bluetooth file transfer feature in iPhone. Installed a tweak, Got it.

  • No file manager? no problem.

  • Need some points or money in games? no problem.

  • Download movies and music directly to iTunes? no problem.

Jailbreak was like a buff for iPhone. Features were not just an imagination on those days. Then i got to know about SIRI. Who didn‚Äôt want a talking smart assistant on their phone? But siri wasn‚Äôt natively available for iPhone 4. well lets install the SIRI using cydia (its a package manager where you can install jailbreak tweaks) then. Lets risk it, what could go wrong right? fingers crossed ü§û.

Something went wrong with installation or dependencies i think, or it wasn‚Äôt just built for the iPhone 4.

My incredible iPhone got bricked üò≠

This is one of the most regretting moment in my life.

I could have just fixed it by formatting everything back to normal but internet was expensive those days and the firmware files was more than a gigs in size. No problem lets fix it.

Bought the internet pack and started downloading firmware files. Fingers crossed again ü§û.

99% and FAILED!!!

I can‚Äôt afford an another data pack. so i just gave up. Bye Bye iPhone üò¢

Sad times. lets get going‚Ä¶

The Game of Roms

Its Year 2014, 16 year old playing with android. Yeah i‚Äôm back to android after i messed up my iPhone. since then i had many android phones changed but in every android phone that i ever owned i did the same thing which is far from rooting. This time i started playing with the Android roms (Android roms are just modified android os) and different kernels, bootloaders, recovery images,etc., available for the specific device i had. I would change the android rom as frequently as 2-3 per week just because it is fun to do. Basically i was addicted to that for a long time. I didn‚Äôt want to stay there but i wanted to learn how the operating system works. Thats how i got introduced to Linux. I was a beginner and a windows user, so linux is scary as well as fun for the first time. Out of curiosity i learned Bash Scripting and made Intelli Tweaks.

Click here to check it out

Intelli tweaks is, as the name suggests, Its tweaking script for rooted android phones which will buff your phone‚Äôs performance; You may have to take a look what it can do and make sure you read the comments too üòÖ. To be honest, i copied a few features from others and added to mine and made my tweaks look unique.

Thats the first ever code/project i ever wrote. Proud Moment üéâ.

I didn‚Äôt know what coding/programming or programming languages was back then. i was just doing everything out of curiousity by reading others works and guides online.

Sometime back then i also learned Ethical Hacking. Basic XSS, SQL Injections, Directory path traversals and a quite few. One day an old indian website caught my eye with a admin login page. Well my curiosity didn‚Äôt stop me to apply SQL injection and the next minute i was inside the website‚Äôs admin panel. So creepy and Scary. while i was looking around i accidently clicked something that made the whole website go nuts and turn off. I didn‚Äôt wanna do anything but to comeout of it. The second day i found that it is fixed. Turned out the first website i hacked. Another Proud Moment üéâ.

Whatever! Its time!. Lets jump a year

Oh wait, I was able to C

We‚Äôre in 2015, the year where it all started. I am a biology student in my highschool. Why? coz i actually chose biology over computer science because i thought choosing CS will bore me and also i love biology. One day our biology teacher was on leave so we stayed back in computer science class. That day was the quiz day for the CS class. I was sitting behind in the corner and answering almost all the questions correctly. CS teacher complemented me in front of whole class and asked me ‚Äù How are you able to answer all those questions? ‚Äú (Honestly those were basic questions not rocket science). I answered ‚ÄúIts basics and i feel computer science is too easy ‚Äú.

One guy out of rage üò§ came to me and made a dare asking me to compile a C program, ‚Äù I‚Äôm not asking you to run but just successfully compile a c program ‚Äú were his words.

I took it seriously and couldn‚Äôt forget it. I went home from school. Took my laptop started searching what the heck is C programming anyway? (Honestly i had no idea what is programming and programming languages are until that day).

Okay it is interesting, we can make computers do things whatever we want. Its basically a superpower! lets learn then?

I borrowed a old C programming book from a friend (Internet wasn‚Äôt a choice still). Started learning and wrote my first ever Hello World program.

#include<stdio.h>

int main(){
    printf("Hello Waseem!");
    return 0;
}

What? i made computer talk? Wow cool

That was a easy program. i mean the easiest program ever. So i didn‚Äôt have any problem until i started digging into it more. The more i learned the more i got warnings and errors.

But going through the book again with what i‚Äôve learned clearly helped me solve all those problems. Its just the compiler is expecting me to write code that it can understand, not some gibberish like missing a semi colon or syntax errors.

so sweet of you compiler.

I was so curious. I learned variables, various data types, conditionals, loopings. But something stopped me progressing and thats Functions, Structs and Pointers.

I asked myself ‚ÄúWhat the heck is Functions? Structures? Pointers?‚Äù.

I was tired understanding those and honestly i couldn‚Äôt. So i gave up hoping one day i could be able to understand those.

Back to time machine

The Comeback

Its early 2016 now. I‚Äôm on summer vactions after those long hectic board exams. Bored and got nothing to do except playing games. One day I‚Äôve decided to join some instituion that can teach me C programming. Thats how i joined NIIT (National Institute of Information Technology) and opted for C, C++, Data Structures and Java course ( bad for wallet obviously but it turned out to be the best decision of my life ).

I was able to learn Functions, Structures and many more finally. Also this was my first ever biggest dumb program i wrote. It just finds the repeated character in a word that you enter.

Alert: Its 150+ lines long, you may have to scroll fast.

I was happy that i could write my own programs now. And i didn‚Äôt stop there. I completed learning C with all those things that i wasn‚Äôt able to understand in past. I eventually moved to C++ where i learned OOPS (Object Oriented Software Programming). Classes, Objects, Encapsulation, Abstraction, Polymorphism and all other was so much fun learning. i made sure i didn‚Äôt stop learning and making things. Some time later i moved to data structures, where i learned all those basic data structures form stacks, queues to trees and heaps.

Dawn of the planet of the Apps

Its Mid 2016, Passed C, C++, Data structures exams and moved on to Java Class. But a bummer there, Only one Java class per week. So i have to wait until a week to learn something new. Dammit!. I didn‚Äôt had patience so i started learning Java on my own. Java was as fun as C and C++ because all the basic core concepts were the same, Syntax is different (Many other factors too but i‚Äôm simplifying here). Java classes bored me because i learned the concepts beforehand that they teach in class. I kept exploring, coding stuffs‚Ä¶

This is one of a early programs i wrote and i am proud of Click here to take a look

One fine day, i got a million dollar question in my mind:

‚ÄúWhy am i learning all this? What can i potentially make something better out of this?‚Äù

Thats when i really want to make use of my coding skill and started Googling. I found out i can make Android Apps since i know Java. Wait no more‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

I started learning Android Programming in Udacity and i gradually started making little basic android apps.

I Moved to College a few months later. I always had a mind for solving problems. i saw a problem with timetables because it is new for me. wait no more i made a Time Table App that can not only show you what period is right now but also remind you whats next. Don‚Äôt mind the name please üòÖ.

Click here to take a look

That was my first successful android project üéâ

Since then, i was always curious to learn the concepts in depth be as it android or any programming languages.

Few months later, a Hackathon was conducted in my college where i created a app for our college bus which will update live status and route of the bus and also alert the students when the bus is near 100-300 meters.

(Unfortunately i lost the code, so i can‚Äôt able to link it here)

I‚Äôve made a lot of apps since then, met a lot of people, made friends, helped a lot of people, made some money too ü§ë.

In 2017,i bought a Macbook Pro 2012, until then i used a old dell laptop with 2 gigs ram. Imagine running android studio in < 2 Gb RAM. Its a nightmare.

The same year, I found a basic thing which whatsapp is missing. That is a video cutting features. i see a lot people want to upload videos or songs that are more than 30 seconds but unfortunately there isn‚Äôt a way unless they have to use a hard way by cutting the videos 30 seconds manually and upload the video as their stories in Whatsapp. Also there is no such app that can do it in the market.

I found that as an oppurtunity and made Klip Kutter. You would‚Äôve guessed it by now. The App that can cut the videos into 30 seconds chunks which can make your life easy.

click here to take a look

Its an instant hit from day 1, I was the first in the market. After a week many apps copied the same functionality and started to pop in the play store.

Then i got introduced to iOS App Development and learned Swift programming language. Honestly Swift is a breeze and beautiful. Swift is the second most language i love.

The first iOS app i made was Venturious. It wasn‚Äôt my idea but a good friend/senior of mine Haashir.

Second, i created Facepass, both for android and iOS. Its basically an app for anonymous messaging but powered with Facial Recognition.

Producthunt: https://www.producthunt.com/posts/facepass
Github: https://github.com/devwaseem/FacePass

Later, the same year. I was hired by a company called Veda and assigned to make an iOS app for Learn America LMS.

Fast Forward

Its 2018, I learned Kotlin which is a progamming language made for Android Apps. Kotlin is similar to Swift but unqiue in its own way. I love Coding using it. With that i decided to make an app. I eventually landed making an App for our college. Its an note keeper app which will provide notes for your class if someone already uploaded. The app was powered by a Chatbot that i made. It was uploaded to playstore intially but recently i removed it because i wasn‚Äôt getting a lot of users.

I also started learning Web Technologies the same year. I learned Nodejs, React, Angular, Vuejs and made a lot of web apps for myself and my clients while i was proiving freelancing service. you can take a look at my instagram for more stuffs.

Some of the Web apps are:

This is the website i‚Äôve created for my college‚Äôs workshop event.

In 2019, I created my profolio website for freelancing.

Link: devwaseem.github.io

Later the same year and early 2019, i was also started learning and desiging UI (User interface).

These are some of the designs

Phewww.. Feeling tired after a long journey? lets go back to 2020 finally üòâ.

Present and Infinity

Its year 2020, finally. This year i started learning Ethical Hacking again. Why? you ask. I know i am good in programming at the same time i love learning in depth and exploring how internals works. The term Hacking isn‚Äôt what i perceive as some guy doing bad things but as the guy who enjoys breaking and learning stuffs in depth. Basically i want to be a security researcher coz i love providing security and breaking it. Even my college final year project is based on the security field. i‚Äôve loved breaking stuffs and learning things in depth as you could‚Äôve known by know if you read all the above sections.

I‚Äôm currently learning and breaking stuffs in a safe way with various labs and platforms. One of the platform is tryhackme which provides a lab setup to learn and break systems.


I‚Äôve also made a simple script called AnonymousBash. Which as name suggests, it will proxy all your bash commands by tunneling it through TOR network.

Link: https://github.com/devwaseem/AnonymousBash

I also play Capture the Flag, which is a game for hackers or any cyber security enthusiast.

The main reason behind the birth of this blog is to post or share my writeups, research, and much more.

I think thats it for now‚Ä¶

FAQ

I‚Äôll answer few FAQ that i frequently get from many people i met.

Before you leave

If you have any constructive criticism or any questions you have, please drop a email at root@n0nu11.tech or ping me in instagram. I‚Äôll be happy to hear your feedbacks.

Follow me on Github, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, TryHackme, HackTheBox
